Title: Germany and Finland receive their first LNG cargos following FSRU launch
Description: Germany and Finland’s first LNG terminals launched this winter received their first cargos. The two countries have turned to LNG to replace the bulk of their lost Russian pipeline supplies following supply cuts last year.
Author: DE

Title: Turkey gives Bulgaria access to its LNG terminals
Description: Turkey gave Bulgaria access to its LNG import terminals as part of a new long-term deal. Bulgaria’s reliance on LNG increased sharply last year amid the Russian pipeline supply cuts, but Bulgaria does not have LNG import infrastructure so it relies on neighbouring countries with such infrastructure.
Author: DE

Title: UK stops importing Russian LNG
Description: The United Kingdom ended all its imports of Russian LNG as of Jan. 1, after already cutting them sharply in 2022 and replacing them with more supplies from the Americas, Qatar, and Africa. The UK’s reliance on LNG increased last year, particularly as the post-Brexit island can no longer rely on continuous pipeline flows from the continent which prioritises intra-EU flows.
Author: DE
